lst.name: sentence
lst.str: During the interview, executive vice president Douglas Yearley said he believed it was only a matter of time before the copper price rose "because there aren't that many new projects coming on, and demand, short of a major recession, will continue to grow modestly."

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Robert Durham said continued strong demand and low inventories pushed prices up eight to nine pct on the New York Commodities Exchange last month.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The company's total production costs, including depreciation but before interest and corporate expense, should be below 50 cts a pound by late 1989 or 1990, he said.
